entry.et: Middle English mudde, probably from Middle Low German

def.dt: :a slimy sticky mixture of solid material with a liquid and especially water
:abusive and malicious remarks or charges political campaigners slinging mud at each other
:anathema 1b usually used in the phrase one's name is mud
:a mixture of water, clay, and chemicals used in oil-well drilling and having various functions (as lubrication and cooling of the bit and flushing of rock particles to the surface)
:any of various wasps (especially family Sphecidae) that construct mud cells in which the female places an egg with spiders or insects paralyzed by a sting to serve as food for the larva
:a large North American salamander (Necturus maculosus) that has external gills and is gray to rusty brown usually with bluish-black spots
:any of a genus (Kinosternon) of American bottom-dwelling freshwater turtles with two transverse hinges on the plastron
:one who is slow, old-fashioned, or unprogressive
